data.title: Botch - American Nervoso (Color Vinyl)
data.meta_description: This was recorded in San Francisco, CA, with Ryan Greene at Motor Studios. NOFX kinda went for more of an old-school sound on this record. More hardcore than the previous one. Now available on colored vinyl. Track Listing: 1. It's My Job To Keep Punk Rock Elite2. Kids Of The K-Hole3. Murder The Government4. Monosyllabic Girl5. 180 Degrees6. All His Suits Are Torn7. All Outta Angst8. I'm Telling Tim9. Champs Elysees10. Dad's Bad News11. Kill Rock Stars12. Eat The Meek13. The Desperation's Gone14. Flossing A Dead Horse15. Quart In Session16. Falling In Love NOFX ST. LOUIS NOFX COLOR VINYL NOFX OUT OF PRINT
data.text:
Legendary Tacoma, WA, mathcore/hardcore/metal band Botch's debut full-length, "American Nervoso," was originally recorded in 1998, eventually becoming one of the most ground-breaking records during a pivotal shift in heavy music. The album features white-hot guitar action, scathing vocals, sweet bass moves, and torrential drums, smashing existing precepts of hardcore and redefining both the word and the music for a generation of kids and grizzled vets alike. The members would go on to play in These Arms Are Snakes, Minus The Bear, and Russian Circles, among others, with acclaim for the band coming mostly post-breakup. LP includes digital download.
